definition: Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
old variant of 捨|舍[she3]
residence
surname She

sentences.english: Lao She's fictions contain the distinct spirit of Mohism and chivalry.
sentences.chinese: 老舍小說蘊涵了鮮明的墨俠精神。

sentences.english: He experienced the shift from a "teacher" to a "writer".
sentences.chinese: 老舍經歷了由“教員”向“寫家”的逐步轉換歷程。

sentences.english: In this sense, the novel can be regarded as an invisible writing of his initial experience of life.
sentences.chinese: 《牛天賜傳》是老舍生命初始經驗的隱形書寫。

sentences.english: And Camel Xiangzi is one of the representatives.
sentences.chinese: 《駱駝祥子》便是老舍的代表作之一。

sentences.english: It was a bestseller in the US where Lao She was a visiting professor.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個暢銷，在美國如老舍是一個客座教授。

sentences.english: It's named after a famous Chinese writer, Lao She.
sentences.chinese: 它是以一位著名的中國作家老舍的名字命名的。

sentences.english: Lao She's novels have a lot of lessons from the art of the storytelling and surpasses it.
sentences.chinese: 老舍小說對評書藝術有諸多借鑑之處，又有所超越。

sentences.english: Medium-length novel the third day 4 look at the moon "was awarded the second prize of Lao she."
sentences.chinese: 中篇小說《初三初四看月亮》獲第二屆老舍文學獎。

sentences.english: Shi Xiaojing's version is faithful to the revised edition of Lao She's novel.
sentences.chinese: 施曉菁的譯本忠實地對老舍的增訂本進行了翻譯。

sentences.english: The literary circles of U. S also introduced Lao She.
sentences.chinese: 對於老舍本人，美國文壇也作了具有針對性的介紹。

sentences.english: Lao She is a language maestro.
The reading of western literary works stimulated Lao She to write.
sentences.chinese: 老舍小說創作起源於西方文學作品的閱讀。

sentences.english: Lao She is a modern intellectual of traditional Chinese spirits.
sentences.chinese: 老舍是集傳統精神之大成的現代知識分子。

sentences.english: Lao she was famous for his play, Teahouse.
sentences.chinese: 老舍因他的話劇《茶館》而聞名。

sentences.english: This text has analyzed the difference of personage's character in the works of two writers emphatically.
sentences.chinese: 本文簡要分析了老舍與張天翼筆下人物的不同點。

definition: Cao Yu (1910-1997), PRC dramatist
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋
Sun Li (1913-2002), novelist
Camel Xiangzi, novel by Lao She 老舍
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Shen Congwen (1902-1988), novelist

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Xiao Hong (1911-1942), prominent woman writer, originally from Heilongjiang
Ji Xianlin (1911-2009), Chinese linguist and Indologist
Yu Dafu (1896-1945), poet and novelist
Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
Zhao Shuli (1906-1970), proletarian novelist
Shu Qingchun (1899-1966), the real name of author Lao She 老舍[Lao3 She3]
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
